titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Larry Goodell Papers
titlestmt.author: by Rosemary K. J. Davis

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 05:22

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Larry Goodell Papers, which span from 1954 to 2016, contain correspondence, writings, business records, posters, audiovisual materials, electronic media, printed material, and other papers by or related to Larry Goodell and Duende Press. The papers contain writings of Larry Goodell as well as correspondence, poetry, and other writings from many poets with whom Goodell had personal relationships or business connections through Duende Press. The records of Duende Press document business dealings between 1968 and 2008, primarily in the form of writings submitted to the press from a variety of poets. Photographs and audiovisual materials,spanning 1968 to 2013, make up the smallest portion of the collection and primarily document poetry readings and performances by Goodell and other regional poets from the Southwestern United States.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 15-16 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 17 (audiocassette): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books, Inc. on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 2016.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence and Writings, 1954-2016. II. Duende Press Records, 1964-2010. III. Berkeley and Vancouver Poetry Conference Papers, 1963-1965. IV. Flyers, 1978-2010. V. Personal Papers, 1968-2005. VI. Audiovisual Materials, 1986-2008.

bioghist.head: Larry Goodell
bioghist.p: Larry Goodell, a prolific poet and publisher, was born in Roswell, New Mexico in 1935. After studying at University of Southern California and the University of New Mexico, Goodell settled in Placitas, New Mexico and started Duende Press in 1964. Duende Press published not only Goodell's poetry, but also the works of other poets such as his former teacher Robert Creeley. Goodell actively participated in the poetry and performance communities of the Southwestern United States, hosting many readings and events from the mid-1960's onward. Goodell also maintained extensive personal and business correspondences with a variety of poets, authors and artists.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Larry Goodell Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Larry Goodell Papers, which span from 1954 to 2016, contain correspondence, writings, business records, posters, audiovisual materials, electronic media, printed material, and other papers by or related to Larry Goodell and Duende Press. The papers contain writings of Larry Goodell as well as correspondence, poetry, and other writings from many poets with whom Goodell had personal relationships or business connections through Duende Press. The records of Duende Press document business dealings between 1968 and 2008, primarily in the form of writings submitted to the press from a variety of poets. Photographs and audiovisual materials,spanning 1968 to 2013, make up the smallest portion of the collection and primarily document poetry readings and performances by Goodell and other regional poets from the Southwestern United States.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Larry Goodell Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Primarily arranged alphabetically by correspondent's last name. Some unsorted correspondence is filed after the alphabetically arranged materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, along with poetry, other writings, and ephemera that were included with the correspondence. The material documents personal and business relationships related to Larry Goodell and Duende Press. Poetry and other writings by Goodell can also be found in Series II, Duende Press records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains business records related to Duende Press--a publishing concern founded and run by Larry Goodell--including writings submitted for publication, documentation of events, and financial records. Poetry and other writings by can also be found in Series I, Correspondence and writings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material within this series have been organized into three subseries: Business records, Submitted writings, and Production materials for Fervent Valley and Oriental and Blue Streak publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.p: Oriental Blue Streak was a one-off magazine edited by Larry Goodell.

did.unittitle: Berkeley and Vancouver Poetry Conference papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains information sheet, notes, correspondence (incoming and outgoing), photographs, clippings and ephemera related to the Larry Goodell's experiences at the Berkeley Poetry Conference (1965) and the Vancouver Poetry Conference (1963). The materials include writings from poetry workshop participants, Goodell's personal journal and photographs, and conference programs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material within this series maintains the original organization found at time of acquisition.

did.unittitle: Berkeley Poetry Conference, July 21-24, 1965--schedules and information sheet
Vancouver Poetry Conference (English 410), July-August 1963--typescripts handed out to participants (2 folders)
Vancouver Poetry Conference (English 410), July-August 1963--spiral-bound journal of LG's Vancouver trip, July-October 1963
Vancouver Poetry Conference (English 410), July-August 1963--correspondence, incl. Warren Tallman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains documentation related to events that Larry Goodell organized, attended, or in which he participated. The materials include flyers, clippings, and ephemera, predominantly related to poetry readings in New Mexico and the Southwestern United States.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material within this series maintains the original organization found at time of acquisition.

did.unittitle: Events with which Larry Goodell was associated
Downtown Center for the Arts, incl. Experimental Performance Festival, 1981 and Albuquerque United Artists
Living Batch Bookstore flyer + Living Batch newsletter
National Poetry Week in Santa Fe
Taos Poetry Circus/World Poetry Bout Association
Poetry readings and other assorted events

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to Larry Goodell's life and work as a poet, teacher and performer. Materials include annotated galley proofs of two books by Goodell, along with student writings from poetry workshops led by Goodell, photographs, documentation of performances by Goodell, and various ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material within this series maintains the original organization found at time of acquisition.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Poetry readings and Music and performance recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains electronic and analog media including audio recordings of poetry readings and musical performances by Larry Goodell and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains audio recordings of poetry readings, performed primarily in the Albuquerque, New Mexico region.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by poet's last name.
